stem: The triage nurse is assessing four victims of a bus accident at the scene. Based on the documented physical findings for each victim, assign the most appropriate START triage tag.

tabs.title: Incident Overview
tabs.content:
14:00: Multi-vehicle bus collision on local highway. Initial reports of 15-20 victims. EMS has established a triage area.

14:15: Triage nurse is performing 30-second assessments on the first wave of victims.

14:30: Scene remains unstable but perimeter is secured. Resources are limited.

tabs.title: Victim Assessments
tabs.content:
VictimRespirationsPerfusion (Pulse/CR)Mental Status
Victim 138/min (Shallow)Radial pulse weak; CR 4sConfused; unable to follow commands
Victim 2None (After airway reposition)No pulse detectedUnresponsive
Victim 324/minRadial pulse strong; CR 2sAlert; followed command to walk to triage area
Victim 422/minRadial pulse strong; CR 2sAlert; follows commands but cannot walk due to likely leg fracture

tabs.title: Injury Findings
tabs.content:
Victim 1: Open head wound with visible brain matter; significant scalp hemorrhage.

Victim 2: Chest crush injury; no chest expansion noted.

Victim 3: Multiple superficial abrasions; reports pain in left shoulder.

Victim 4: Closed deformity of the right femur; pedal pulses present.

rows.text: Victim 2: No respirations after airway repositioning
Victim 3: Alert, follows commands, walked to triage area
Victim 4: RR 22/min, CR 2s, follows commands, unable to walk

rationale.correct: Victim 1 is **Red (Immediate)** because their respiratory rate is greater than 30/min and their capillary refill is greater than 2 seconds, indicating they have failed the RPM (Respirations, Perfusion, Mental Status) assessment. Victim 2 is **Black (Expectant)** because they have no respirations even after the airway is opened. Victim 3 is **Green (Minor)** as they are a 'walking wounded'. Victim 4 is **Yellow (Delayed)** because they pass the RPM criteria (RR < 30/min, CR < 2s, follows commands) but have a significant injury that prevents them from walking.
clinicalPearls: START Triage rule: 30-2-Can Do. (RR over 30? Cap refill over 2s? Can't follow commands? = RED).
Always check respirations FIRST. If none, open the airway; if still none, mark BLACK.
Green victims (walking wounded) can assist with basic tasks, such as applying pressure to wounds.

questionTrap.trap: Labeling a screaming, walking person as 'Red' because of their pain level or injury appearance.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: If they can walk, they are automatically Green, regardless of how much blood they have on them or how much pain they report. Focus on the RPM assessment.

mnemonic.title: RPM Triage
mnemonic.expansion: R-Respirations (over 30/min?), P-Perfusion (Capillary Refill over 2s?), M-Mental status (Can't follow commands?)
